comment._content: the NGAA, which Hexamer founded in 1901 and served as president until 1917, was forced to disband under political pressure in 1918, when American was at war with Germany. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_German-American_Alliance Hexamer was in the news on September 15, 1915 when, on behalf of his organization, he sent a telegram to all members opposing the proposed $1 Billion Anglo-French loan to the Allies as the work of "the Money Trust, the most sinister influence in our national life." He also advised members to withdraw their funds en masse from the banks in protest. select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F20814FE395D1673...
